intro: Hieracium silsetense, commonly known as the Silsetense hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring moist and well-drained soils. It features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium silsetense is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich soils.
